dating.remarks: [Barnes foundation, online database, acessed 02.11.2020](https://collection.barnesfoundation.org/objects/6060/Portrait-of-Frederick-the-Wise-Duke-of-Saxony/) [Dr. Larry Silver during a Collections Assessment Project, Feb. 2004]

pageContext.description:
A bust-length portrait of Friedrich the Wise in three quarter profile against a neutral background, facing to his left. The elector is wearing a fur-trimmed black cloak over a white pleated shirt. His black beret is placed at an angle on his head. 
[cda 2020]

restorationSurveys.remarks:
Support:
The wood panel was thinned and mounted to a plywood support in the early twentieth century by Barnes conservator, Albert Nulty.
The original panel thickness is 0.4 cm and the plywood support is 0.8 cm
[Barnes Foundation, revised 2020]

pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia above the sitter's proper right shoulder: serpent with elevated wings, facing right; in black paint
